body: Mark Berndt starts as a teacher at Miramonte, where he eventually teaches 3rd and 5th grade students.
title: Berndt begins as Miramonte teacher
caption: Miramonte Elementary School in Los Angeles, California February 6, 2012.

body: Mark Berndt takes the class on a field trip to the museum and "drops his pants" in front of them. Parents complain to L.A. Unified but nothing was done.
title: Berndt 'drops his pants' to students
caption: An apology note from Berdt to the principal at the time. Credit: LA County Sheriff's Department

body: Girls report Berndt is masterbating in class. Girls are put into counseling by Miramonte Administration. No remedial action is taken against Berndt.
title: Complaints of public masturbation

body: Fellow teacher at Miramonte reports to Principal that Berndt is wearing short shorts with no underwear and sitting on edge of desk  exposing penis and testicles to class. In response to the complaint  the principal said  "I know, baby. Parents complain about him. There's nothing I can do. He's got tenure."
title: Complaints of indecent exposure
caption: This 2003 photo shows former Miramontes Elementary teacher Mark Berndt with a 3rd grader, holding a citizenship diploma given to her by Brendt, at the school in Los Angeles. Credit: AP Photo/Flor Cervantes

body: A student reports she has been fondled by Berndt while taking a test. The parent reports it  LAUSD files SCAR report and LASD does investigation. The DA declines to file charges. LAUSD does not remove Berndt from class.
title: Reports of fondling student

body: A student brings home a photo taken by Berndt of herself eating a cookie. Mother is upset calls LAUSD. The principal transfers girl to Martin Springer's class. Nothing is done to Berndt.
title: Mother complains of 'cookie' photo
caption: This 2003 photo shows former Miramontes Elementary teacher Mark Berndt with a third-grader, at the school in Los Angeles. Credit: AP Photo/Flor Cervantes

body: Mark Berndt is informed he is being investigated by LASD and is removed from Miramonte. The District suspends him and initiates steps to fire him.
title: Suspension and sheriff's investigation
caption: The Miramonte Elementary school's principal, Martin Sandoval speaks to the media outside his school in Los Angeles on Jan. 31, 2012.

body: An attorney with the law firm representing Berndt argues that the district's reasons for firing Berndt were "indefinite and uncertain," that Berndt is "fit to teach," and the "charges fail to state any facts and are conclusive in nature," according to documents filed with the court.
title: Berndt sues LA Unified

body: Berndt is arrested by L.A. Sheriff's Department.
title: Berndt is arrested
caption: Berndt's booking photo. Credit: LA Sheriff's Department

body: In a court hearing,  L.A. Unified admits district destroyed records containing allegations of sexual abuse at L.A. public schools dating back to 1988.
title: LA Unified admits to destroying records
caption: Students are escorted to a waiting bus as they leave Miramonte Elementary school after classes Jan. 31, 2012. Credit: Damian Dovarganes/AP

body: L.A. Unified agrees to pay about $40,000 to settle its dismissal case against Berndt.
title: LA Unified pays $40K settlement to Berndt
caption: Los Angeles schools Supt. John Deasy  speaks during a press conference at South Region High School #2 in Los Angeles, California February 6, 2012.  Deasy earlier informed parents at a community meeting that the district is replacing the entire staff of Miramonte Elementary School in the wake of the arrests last week of two teachers on lewd conduct charges. Credit: Krista Kennell/AFP/Getty Images

body: L.A. Unified agrees to pay $30 million to settle 58 claims of abuse relating to Berndt.
title: LA Unified settles with parents
caption: Parents and children protest outside Miramonte Elementary School in Los Angeles, California, February 6, 2012. KRISTA KENNELL/AFP/GETTY IMAGES

body: Berndt pleads no contest to one count of lewd and lascivious acts upon a child.
title: Berndt pleads no contest
caption: Former Los Angeles teacher Mark Berndt, 62, is seen during his change-of-plea hearing in Los Angeles Friday, Nov. 15, 2013. Credit: AP Photo/Damian Dovarganes

body: In the largest civil settlement L.A. Unified has ever agreed to, lawyers for the district agreed to pay a total of nearly $140 million to dozens of students of Miramonte Elementary School who had filed a civil lawsuit against the district over its handling of the sexual abuse case.
title: LAUSD settles civil case for $140 million
